Dictionary containing the layout options for the plotly plots.

class main.MainWindow(parent)[source]¶

Bases: mainFrame

Class for the GUI backend.

Methods

connectLabJack:

Connect to the Labjack U6 device.

bindingEnergyToVolt:

Convert the binding energy to voltage for the MAX5216 DAC.

setSpiVoltage:

Set the voltage at the MAX5216 DAC.

startMeasurement:

Start the measurement process.

runSingleMeasurement:

Run a single measurement.

runBatchMeasurement:

Run a batch measurement.

saveMeasurementData:

Save the measurement data to a CSV file.

sendSharedData:

Method to save data to the Shared Memory which is also accessed by the plot server for plotting.

startPlotServer:

Code to execute when the Restart Plot Server button is clicked.

enableControls:

Enable the controls in the UI.

disableControls:

Disable the controls in the UI.

interruptionClicked:

Handle the interruption of the measurement.

onClose:

Method fired when the close button is clicked.
BATCH_END_EV = 1¶

Index of the end energy value in the batch input table.

BATCH_PASSES = 4¶

Index of the number of passes value in the batch input table.

BATCH_START_EV = 0¶

Index of the start energy value in the batch input table.

BATCH_STEP_EV = 2¶

Index of the step energy value in the batch input table.

BATCH_TIME_PER_STEP = 3¶

Index of the time per step value in the batch input table.

  1# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
  2import os
  3import subprocess
  4import time
  5from dependencies import mainframe
  6import wx
  7import pywinstyles
  8
  9# import u6
 10from dependencies import dummy_labjack_u6 as u6
 11import threading
 12
 13# import LabJackPython as ljud
 14import polars as pl
 15
 16# Library to plot the data, during (live) and after measurement
 17import plotly.graph_objects as go
 18import plotly.io as pio
 19from dash_bootstrap_templates import load_figure_template
 20
 21from shared_memory_dict import SharedMemoryDict
 22
 23# **************************************************************************
 24
 25load_figure_template(["bootstrap"])
 26
 27BOOTSTRAP = pio.templates["bootstrap"]
 28"""Bootstrap template for the plotly figure."""
 29
 30CONFIG = dict({
 31    "scrollZoom": True,
 32    "displaylogo": False,
 33    "toImageButtonOptions": {
 34        "format": "svg",  # one of png, svg, jpeg, webp
 35        "filename": "custom_image",
 36        "height": None,
 37        "width": None,
 38        "scale": 1,  # Multiply title/legend/axis/canvas sizes by this factor
 39    },
 40    "modeBarButtonsToRemove": ["select2d", "lasso2d"],
 41})
 42"""Dictionary containing configuration options for the plotly plots."""
 43LAYOUT = dict(
 44    autosize=True,
 45    template=BOOTSTRAP,
 46    margin=dict(l=70, r=50, b=50, t=50, pad=4),
 47    dragmode="pan",
 48    font_size=11,
 49    hovermode="closest",
 50    modebar={"orientation": "v"},
 51)
 52"""Dictionary containing the layout options for the plotly plots."""
 53
 54
 55def reset_fig(batch_mode: bool = False) -> go.Figure:
 56    """Method to create blank plot figure.
 57
 58    Parameters
 59    ----------
 60    batch_mode : bool, optional
 61        Boolean indicating if the measurement is a batch mode measurement, by default False
 62
 63    Returns
 64    -------
 65    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 66        The plotly Figure object created.
 67    """
 68    trace_name = "pass_1"
 69    if batch_mode:
 70        trace_name = "b1_pass_1"
 71    fig = go.Figure(
 72        data=[go.Scatter(x=[], y=[], mode="markers+lines", line_width=1, marker_size=4, name=trace_name)],
 73        layout=go.Layout(
 74            **LAYOUT,
 75            xaxis_title="Binding Energy [eV]",
 76            yaxis_title="Counts",
 77            uirevision="no_change",
 78            legend={
 79                "orientation": "h",
 80                "xanchor": "center",
 81                "x": 0.5,
 82            },
 83        ),
 84    )
 85
 86    fig = addPlotRefLines(fig)
 87
 88    return fig
 89
 90
 91def addPlotRefLines(fig: go.Figure) -> go.Figure:
 92    """Method to add reference photoelectron spectral lines to the plot figure.
 93
 94    Parameters
 95    ----------
 96    fig : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 97        The pltoly graph objects in which the reference lines are to be added.
 98
 99    Returns
100    -------
101    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
102        The plotly Figure object with the added reference lines.
103    """
104    fig.add_vline(
105        x=83.95,
106        line=dict(
107            color="#B3DF72",
108            width=3,
109            dash="dash",
110        ),
111        opacity=0.6,
112        name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{7/2}$",
113        showlegend=True,
114    )
115    fig.add_vline(
116        x=87.9,
117        line=dict(
118            color="#FD9891",
119            width=3,
120            dash="dash",
121        ),
122        opacity=0.6,
123        name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{5/2}$",
124        showlegend=True,
125    )
126    fig.add_vline(
127        x=284.4,
128        line=dict(
129            color="#FEC195",
130            width=3,
131            dash="dash",
132        ),
133        opacity=0.6,
134        name=r"$\large \text{C 1s}$",
135        showlegend=True,
136    )
137    fig.add_vline(
138        x=72.84,
139        line=dict(
140            color="#F5CD47",
141            width=3,
142            dash="dash",
143        ),
144        opacity=0.6,
145        name=r"$\large \text{Al 2p}_\text{3/2}$",
146        showlegend=True,
147    )
148    fig.add_vline(
149        x=532.70,
150        line=dict(
151            color="#7EE2B8",
152            width=3,
153            dash="dash",
154        ),
155        opacity=0.6,
156        name=r"$\large \text{O 1s}$",
157        showlegend=True,
158    )
159    fig.add_vline(
160        x=118,
161        line=dict(
162            color="#9DD9EE",
163            width=3,
164            dash="dash",
165        ),
166        opacity=0.6,
167        name=r"$\large \text{Al 2s}$",
168        showlegend=True,
169    )
170
171    return fig
172
173
174def addOrUpdatePlotTraceData(
175    fig: go.Figure, pass_index: int, x_data: pl.Series, y_data: pl.Series, trace_name: str
176) -> go.Figure:
177    """Method to add or update the trace in the plotly Figure object.
178
179    Parameters
180    ----------
181    fig : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
182        The plotly Figure object in which the trace dat is to be added or updated.
183    pass_index : int
184        The integer indicating the pass no. of the new data to be updated.
185    x_data : pl.Series
186        The x coordinates for the trace to be added or updated.
187    y_data : pl.Series
188        The y coordinates for the trace data to be added or updated.
189    trace_name : str
190        The trace name that is to be added or updated.
191
192    Returns
193    -------
194    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
195        The plotly Figure object after adding or updating the traces.
196    """
197    existing_passes = len(fig["data"])
198    if existing_passes < pass_index:
199        fig.add_trace(
200            go.Scatter(
201                x=x_data,
202                y=y_data,
203                mode="markers+lines",
204                line_width=1,
205                marker_size=4,
206                name=trace_name,
207            )
208        )
209    fig.update_traces(
210        overwrite=False,
211        x=x_data,
212        y=y_data,
213        selector=dict(name=trace_name),
214    )
215
216    return fig
217
218
219app = wx.App(False)
220"""The wxApp for the GUI frontend."""
221
222
223class MainWindow(mainframe.mainFrame):
224    """Class for the GUI backend.
225
226    Methods
227    -------
228    connectLabJack:
229        Connect to the Labjack U6 device.
230    bindingEnergyToVolt:
231        Convert the binding energy to voltage for the MAX5216 DAC.
232    setSpiVoltage:
233        Set the voltage at the MAX5216 DAC.
234    startMeasurement:
235        Start the measurement process.
236    runSingleMeasurement:
237        Run a single measurement.
238    runBatchMeasurement:
239        Run a batch measurement.
240    saveMeasurementData:
241        Save the measurement data to a CSV file.
242    sendSharedData:
243        Method to save data to the Shared Memory which is also accessed by the plot server for plotting.
244    startPlotServer:
245        Code to execute when the Restart Plot Server button is clicked.
246    enableControls:
247        Enable the controls in the UI.
248    disableControls:
249        Disable the controls in the UI.
250    interruptionClicked:
251        Handle the interruption of the measurement.
252    onClose:
253        Method fired when the close button is clicked.
254    """
255
256    BATCH_START_EV = 0
257    """Index of the start energy value in the batch input table."""
258    BATCH_END_EV = 1
259    """Index of the end energy value in the batch input table."""
260    BATCH_STEP_EV = 2
261    """Index of the step energy value in the batch input table."""
262    BATCH_TIME_PER_STEP = 3
263    """Index of the time per step value in the batch input table."""
264    BATCH_PASSES = 4
265    """Index of the number of passes value in the batch input table."""
266    EXCITATION_AL = 1486.6
267    """The excitation energy for Aluminium cathode."""
268    EXCITATION_MG = 1253.6
269    """The excitation energy for Magnesium cathode."""
270    U6_MOSI_PIN_NUM = 2
271    """The MOSI pin number for the Labjack U6."""
272    U6_MISO_PIN_NUM = 4
273    """The MISO pin number for the Labjack U6."""
274    U6_CLK_PIN_NUM = 1
275    """The CLK pin number for the Labjack U6."""
276    U6_CS_PIN_NUM = 3
277    """The CS pin number for the Labjack U6."""
278    DEP_PATH = ".\\src\\dependencies\\"
279    """Path for all the files that the program requires to function."""
280    # These variables contain settings for the plotly plots / live plot seen in the UI
281    CONFIG = dict({
282        "scrollZoom": True,
283        "displaylogo": False,
284        "toImageButtonOptions": {
285            "format": "svg",  # one of png, svg, jpeg, webp
286            "filename": "custom_image",
287            "height": None,
288            "width": None,
289            "scale": 1,  # Multiply title/legend/axis/canvas sizes by this factor
290        },
291        "modeBarButtonsToRemove": ["select2d", "lasso2d"],
292    })
293    """Dictionary containing configuration options for the plotly plots."""
294    LAYOUT = dict(
295        autosize=True,
296        template=BOOTSTRAP,
297        margin=dict(l=70, r=50, b=50, t=50, pad=4),
298        dragmode="pan",
299        font_size=11,
300        hovermode="closest",
301        modebar={"orientation": "v"},
302    )
303    """Dictionary containing the layout options for the plotly plots."""
304
305    start_ev: float
306    """The starting energy value for the measurement."""
307    end_ev: float
308    """The ending energy value for the measurement."""
309    step_ev: float
310    """The step width for the measurement."""
311    setpoint_ev: float
312    """The current energy value for the measurement."""
313    time_per_step: float
314    """The time per step for the measurement."""
315    pass_no: int
316    """The number of passes for the measurement."""
317    u6_labjack: u6.U6
318    """Lajack U6 object for the measurement."""
319    labjack_connect: bool
320    """Boolean to check if the Labjack is connected."""
321    data_table: pl.DataFrame
322    """Polars DataFrame to store the measurement data."""
323    pass_row_indexes: list
324    """List of row indices indicating start of new passes."""
325    typ_schema: dict
326    """Dictionary with the type schema for the polars Dataframe."""
327    measurement_thread: threading.Thread
328    """Thread object to run the measurement."""
329    excitation_voltage: float
330    """Selected excitation voltage for the measurement."""
331    plot_fig: go.Figure
332    """Plotly figure object to plot the measurement data."""
333    share_mem_plot_data: SharedMemoryDict
334    """Shared memory buffer to store the plot data."""
335    plot_server_process: subprocess.Popen
336    """Plot server process to display the plot in the UI."""
337    plot_file_name: str
338    """HTML plot file name."""
339    meas_interrupted: bool = False
340    """Boolean to check if the measurement was interrupted."""
341    meas_interrupt_id: int
342    """ID of the button that was clicked to interrupt the measurement."""
343    meas_running: bool = False
344    """Boolean to check if the measurement is running."""
345    total_batch_passes: int = 0
346    """Integer holding the total batch passes during the batch mode measurement."""
347    batch_pass_no: int = 1
348    """Integer holding the current batch pass no. during a batch measurement."""
349    batch_step_no: int = 1
350    """Integer holding the current step no. during a batch mode measuremeet."""
351    plot_iter:int = 1
352    """Integer holding the plot iteration of the measurement. Reset to 1 after every measurement."""
353
354    def __init__(self, parent) -> None:
355        """
356        Initialize the main window of the program.
357
358        Parameters
359        ----------
360        parent : wx.Window
361            The parent window of the main window.
362
363        """
364        mainframe.mainFrame.__init__(self, parent)
365        self.Bind(wx.EVT_CLOSE, self.onClose)
366        self.connectLabjack()
367
368        # Disable history in for the plot window (browser based).
369        self.plotView.EnableHistory(False)
370
371        # Disable plot window DevTools access.
372        self.plotView.EnableAccessToDevTools(True)
373
374        # Disable plot window context menu.
375        self.plotView.EnableContextMenu(True)
376
377        self.plot_file_name = "".join([os.getcwd(), "\\src\\dependencies\\", "plt_dat.html"])
378
379        self.share_mem_plot_data = SharedMemoryDict(name="plotdata", size=3000)
380        self.startPlotServer(None)
381        new_data_temp = {
382            "Binding Energy [eV]": None,
383            "Pass No.": 1,
384            "Time_per_step [s]": None,
385            "Counts": None,
386            "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": None,
387            "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": None,
388            "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": None,
389        }
390        self.share_mem_plot_data["interval"] = 0.5
391        self.sendSharedData(new_data_temp, False, True, False, 1, 1)
392        # Load plot html in the plot window.
393        self.plotView.LoadURL("http://localhost:8050/")
394        self.pass_row_indexes = []
395
396        self.Fit()
397        self.Update()
398
399    def connectLabjack(self) -> None:
400        """Connect to the Labjack U6 device."""
401        self.u6_labjack = u6.U6()
402        self.u6_labjack.getCalibrationData()
403        self.u6_labjack.configIO(EnableCounter0=True)
404        # ljud.eDAC(self.u6_labjack, 1, 3)  # Set the reference voltage for the MAX5216 DAC
405        self.u6_labjack.getFeedback(u6.DAC1_8(self.u6_labjack.voltageToDACBits(3, 1)))
406        self.labjack_connect = True
407
408    def bindingEnergyToVolt(self, binding_energy: float) -> float:
409        """Convert the binding energy to voltage for the MAX5216 DAC.
410
411        Parameters
412        ----------
413        binding_energy : float
414            The binding energy value.
415
416        Returns
417        -------
418        float
419            The voltage value for the MAX5216 DAC.
420
421        """
422        self.setpoint_ev = binding_energy
423        kinetic_energy = self.excitation_voltage - binding_energy
424        self.bindingEnergy.SetValue(str(binding_energy))
425        self.kineticEnergy.SetValue(str(kinetic_energy))
426        self.Update()
427        return kinetic_energy / 498.43
428
429    def setSpiVoltage(self, volt: float) -> None:
430        """Set the voltage at the MAX5216 DAC.
431
432        Parameters
433        ----------
434        volt : float
435            The voltage value to set at the MAX5216 DAC.
436
437        """
438        ref_volt_at_MAX5216_DAC = self.u6_labjack.getAIN(3)  # the reference voltage at the DAC MAX5216
439        volt_bits = int(
440            volt * 65535 / ref_volt_at_MAX5216_DAC
441        )  # convert input volts to a 16 bit scaled value with the reference voltage
442        volt_bits = (
443            volt_bits << 6
444        )  # shift the 16 bit value 6 bits to the left to make it a 22 bit value. Refer to MAX5216 datasheet
445        volt_bits |= (
446            1 << 22
447        )  # set the 23rd bit to 1 to indicate that the first 2 bits are the command bits. Refer to MAX5216 datasheet
448        self.u6_labjack.spi(
449            list(volt_bits.to_bytes(3)),
450            CSPINNum=self.U6_CS_PIN_NUM,
451            CLKPinNum=self.U6_CLK_PIN_NUM,
452            MISOPinNum=self.U6_MISO_PIN_NUM,
453            MOSIPinNum=self.U6_MOSI_PIN_NUM,
454        )
455        # ljud.eDAC(self.u6_labjack, 0, volt)  # Set the voltage at DAC0 of the Labjack for comparison with MAX5216.
456        self.u6_labjack.getFeedback(u6.DAC0_8(self.u6_labjack.voltageToDACBits(volt, 0)))
457
458    def startMeasurement(self, event: wx.Event) -> None:
459        """Start the measurement process.
460
461        Parameters
462        ----------
463        event : wxEvent
464            wxEVT_BUTTON event generated.
465
466        """
467        if self.excitationSelect.GetValue():
468            # if the excitation slider in the UI is set to Mg, value will be 1. Hence True.
469            self.excitation_voltage = self.EXCITATION_MG
470        else:
471            self.excitation_voltage = self.EXCITATION_AL
472
473        if self.modeSelect.GetSelection():
474            # if Batch Scan tab is selected in the UI. Batch scan mode is 1. Single scan mode is 0.
475
476            start_ev: float
477            end_ev: float
478            step_ev: float
479            time_per_step: float
480            pass_no: int
481
482            total_time_s = 0
483            total_steps = 0
484            self.total_batch_passes = 0
485            self.batch_pass_no = 1
486            self.batch_step_no = 1
487
488            for row_index in range(1, self.batchInput.GetNumberRows()):
489                batch_time = 0
490                start_ev = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_START_EV).strip()
491                end_ev = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_END_EV).strip()
492                step_ev = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_STEP_EV).strip()
493                time_per_step = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_TIME_PER_STEP).strip()
494                pass_no = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_PASSES).strip()
495                if (
496                    not len(start_ev)
497                    or not len(end_ev)
498                    or not len(step_ev)
499                    or not len(time_per_step)
500                    or not len(pass_no)
501                ):
502                    break
503                batch_time = (
504                    float(time_per_step) * float(pass_no) * ((float(end_ev) - float(start_ev)) / float(step_ev) + 1)
505                )
506                total_time_s += batch_time
507                total_steps += ((float(end_ev) - float(start_ev)) / float(step_ev) + 1) * pass_no
508                self.total_batch_passes += pass_no
509
510            self.elapsedTime.SetValue("0")
511            self.remainingTime.SetValue(str(round(total_time_s / 60, 2)))
512            self.measProgress.SetRange(float(total_steps))
513            self.measProgress.SetValue(0)
514            self.measurement_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.runBatchMeasurement)
515            self.plot_fig = reset_fig(batch_mode=True)
516        else:
517            self.start_ev = self.singleStarteV.GetValue()
518            self.end_ev = self.singleEndeV.GetValue()
519            self.step_ev = self.singleStepWidtheV.GetValue()
520            self.time_per_step = self.singleTimePerStep.GetValue()
521            self.pass_no = self.singlePasses.GetValue()
522            self.measProgress.SetRange(int(abs((self.end_ev - self.start_ev) / self.step_ev + 1) * self.pass_no))
523            total_time_s = self.time_per_step * self.pass_no * ((self.end_ev - self.start_ev) / self.step_ev + 1)
524            self.remainingTime.SetValue(str(round(total_time_s / 60, 2)))
525            self.elapsedTime.SetValue("0")
526            self.measProgress.SetValue(0)
527
528            self.measurement_thread = threading.Thread(
529                target=self.runSingleMeasurement,
530                args=[self.start_ev, self.end_ev, self.step_ev, self.time_per_step, self.pass_no, 0, 0, False],
531            )
532            self.plot_fig = reset_fig()
533
534        self.typ_schema = {
535            "Binding Energy [eV]": pl.Float64,
536            "Pass No.": pl.Float64,
537            "Time_per_step [s]": pl.Float64,
538            "Counts": pl.Float64,
539            "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": pl.Float64,
540            "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": pl.Float64,
541            "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": pl.Float64,
542        }
543        data_temp = {
544            "Binding Energy [eV]": [],
545            "Pass No.": [],
546            "Time_per_step [s]": [],
547            "Counts": [],
548            "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": [],
549            "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": [],
550            "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": [],
551        }
552
553        self.data_table = pl.DataFrame(
554            data_temp,
555            schema=self.typ_schema,
556        )
557
558        self.pass_row_indexes = [0]
559        new_data_temp = {
560            "Binding Energy [eV]": None,
561            "Pass No.": 1,
562            "Time_per_step [s]": None,
563            "Counts": None,
564            "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": None,
565            "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": None,
566            "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": None,
567        }
568        batch_mode_check = False
569        if self.modeSelect.GetSelection():
570            batch_mode_check = True
571        self.sendSharedData(new_data_temp, False, True, batch_mode_check, 1, 1)
572
573        self.meas_running = True
574        self.meas_interrupted = False
575        self.measurement_thread.start()
576
577        self.disableControls()
578        event.Skip()
579
580    def runSingleMeasurement(
581        self,
582        start_ev: float,
583        end_ev: float,
584        step_ev: float,
585        time_per_step: float,
586        pass_no: int,
587        batch_no: int,
588        batch_pass_no: int,
589        type_batch=False,
590    ) -> None:
591        """Run a single measurement.
592
593        Parameters
594        ----------
595        start_ev : float
596            The starting energy value for the measurement in eV.
597        end_ev : float
598            The ending energy value for the measurement in eV.
599        step_ev : float
600            The step width for the measurement in eV.
601        time_per_step : float
602            The time per step for the measurement in s.
603        pass_no : int
604            The number of passes for the measurement.
605        type_batch : bool
606            The type of measurement. True for batch measurement, False for single measurement.
607
608        """
609        self.setSpiVoltage(self.bindingEnergyToVolt(start_ev))
610
611        pass_index = 1
612
613        typ_schema = {
614            "Binding Energy [eV]": pl.Float64,
615            "Counts": pl.Float64,
616        }
617        data_temp = {
618            "Binding Energy [eV]": [],
619            "Counts": [],
620        }
621
622        plot_dataframe = pl.DataFrame(
623            data_temp,
624            schema=typ_schema,
625        )
626
627        self.share_mem_plot_data["interval"] = time_per_step
628
629
630        while pass_index <= pass_no:
631            self.u6_labjack.getFeedback(u6.Counter0(True))
632            start_time = time.time()
633            __refresh_time = 0
634            while __refresh_time <= time_per_step:
635                if self.meas_interrupted:
636                    break
637                if __refresh_time + 1 < time_per_step:
638                    time.sleep(1)
639                    __refresh_time += 1
640                else:
641                    time.sleep(time_per_step - __refresh_time)
642                    break
643
644            if self.meas_interrupted:
645                self.meas_interrupted = False
646                if self.meas_interrupt_id == wx.ID_CANCEL:
647                    self.measProgress.SetValue(0)
648                    data_temp = {
649                        "Binding Energy [eV]": None,
650                        "Pass No.": 1,
651                        "Time_per_step [s]": None,
652                        "Counts": None,
653                        "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": None,
654                        "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": None,
655                        "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": None,
656                    }
657                    self.data_table = pl.DataFrame(
658                        data_temp,
659                        schema=self.typ_schema,
660                    )
661
662                    self.pass_row_indexes = [0]
663                    self.sendSharedData(data_temp, False, True, False, 1, 1)
664                    return
665                else:
666                    self.saveMeasurementData(False)
667                    return
668            # time.sleep(self.time_per_step)
669            # counts = ljud.eTCValues(
670            #     self.u6_labjack,
671            #     aReadTimers=[0, 0, 0, 0],
672            #     aUpdateResetTimers=[0, 0, 0, 0],
673            #     aReadCounters=[1, 0],
674            #     aResetCounters=[0, 0],
675            #     aTimerValues=[0, 0, 0, 0],
676            # )[1][0]
677            counts = self.u6_labjack.getFeedback(u6.Counter0(False))[0]
678            time_taken = time.time() - start_time  # record in s
679            binding_energy = self.setpoint_ev
680            counts_per_milli = round(counts / (time_taken * 1000), 6)
681            u6_dac0_voltage = round(self.u6_labjack.getAIN(0), 6)
682            max5216_dac_voltage = round(self.u6_labjack.getAIN(2), 6)
683
684            new_data = {
685                "Binding Energy [eV]": binding_energy,
686                "Pass No.": pass_index,
687                "Time_per_step [s]": time_taken,
688                "Counts": counts,
689                "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": counts_per_milli,
690                "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": u6_dac0_voltage,
691                "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": max5216_dac_voltage,
692            }
693
694            new_plot_point = pl.DataFrame(
695                {
696                    "Binding Energy [eV]": [binding_energy],
697                    "Counts": [counts],
698                },
699                schema=typ_schema,
700            )
701            plot_dataframe = pl.concat([plot_dataframe, new_plot_point])
702
703            new_df = pl.DataFrame(new_data, schema=self.typ_schema)
704            self.data_table = pl.concat([self.data_table, new_df])
705            if not type_batch:
706                self.plot_fig = addOrUpdatePlotTraceData(
707                    self.plot_fig,
708                    pass_index,
709                    plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
710                    plot_dataframe["Counts"],
711                    f"pass_{pass_index}",
712                )
713            else:
714                self.plot_fig = addOrUpdatePlotTraceData(
715                    self.plot_fig,
716                    self.batch_pass_no,
717                    plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
718                    plot_dataframe["Counts"],
719                    f"b{batch_no}_pass_{pass_index}",
720                )
721            # if not type_batch:
722            #     if existing_passes < pass_index:
723            #         self.pass_row_indexes.append(temp_row_index)
724            #         self.plot_fig.add_trace(
725            #             go.Scatter(
726            #                 x=plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
727            #                 y=plot_dataframe["Counts"],
728            #                 mode="markers+lines",
729            #                 line_width=1,
730            #                 marker_size=4,
731            #                 name=f"pass_{pass_index}",
732            #             )
733            #         )
734            #     self.plot_fig.update_traces(
735            #         overwrite=False,
736            #         x=plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
737            #         y=plot_dataframe["Counts"],
738            #         selector=dict(name=f"pass_{pass_index}"),
739            #     )
740            # else:
741            #     if existing_passes < self.batch_pass_no:
742            #         self.plot_fig.add_trace(
743            #             go.Scatter(
744            #                 x=plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
745            #                 y=plot_dataframe["Counts"],
746            #                 mode="markers+lines",
747            #                 line_width=1,
748            #                 marker_size=4,
749            #                 name=f"b{batch_no}_pass_{pass_index}",
750            #             )
751            #         )
752            #     self.plot_fig.update_traces(
753            #         overwrite=False,
754            #         x=plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
755            #         y=plot_dataframe["Counts"],
756            #         selector=dict(name=f"b{batch_no}_pass_{pass_index}"),
757            #     )
758            self.plot_fig.write_html(
759                self.plot_file_name,
760                config=self.CONFIG,
761                include_plotlyjs="cdn",
762            )
763
764            self.sendSharedData(new_data, True, False, type_batch, batch_no, self.plot_iter)
765
766            self.measProgress.SetValue(self.measProgress.GetValue() + 1)
767            new_remaining_time = float(self.remainingTime.GetValue()) - time_taken / 60
768            self.remainingTime.SetValue(str(round(new_remaining_time, 2)))
769            new_elapsed_time = float(self.elapsedTime.GetValue()) + time_taken / 60
770            self.elapsedTime.SetValue(str(round(new_elapsed_time, 2)))
771
772            if self.setpoint_ev + step_ev <= end_ev:
773                self.setpoint_ev += step_ev
774                if type_batch:
775                    self.batch_step_no += 1
776                self.setSpiVoltage(self.bindingEnergyToVolt(self.setpoint_ev))
777            else:
778                self.setSpiVoltage(self.bindingEnergyToVolt(start_ev))
779                pass_index += 1
780                if type_batch:
781                    self.batch_pass_no += 1
782                plot_dataframe = pl.DataFrame(
783                    {
784                        "Binding Energy [eV]": [],
785                        "Counts": [],
786                    },
787                    typ_schema,
788                )
789
790            self.Update()
791            self.plot_iter += 1
792
793        self.saveMeasurementData(type_batch)
794
795    def runBatchMeasurement(self) -> None:
796        """Run a batch measurement."""
797        for row_index in self.batchInput.GetNumberRows():
798            if self.meas_running:
799                self.start_ev = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_START_EV).strip()
800                self.end_ev = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_END_EV).strip()
801                self.step_ev = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_STEP_EV).strip()
802                self.time_per_step = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_TIME_PER_STEP).strip()
803                self.pass_no = self.batchInput.GetCellValue(row_index, self.BATCH_PASSES).strip()
804                if (
805                    not len(self.start_ev)
806                    or not len(self.end_ev)
807                    or not len(self.step_ev)
808                    or not len(self.time_per_step)
809                    or not len(self.pass_no)
810                ):
811                    self.saveMeasurementData(False)
812                    break
813                self.runSingleMeasurement(
814                    self.start_ev,
815                    self.end_ev,
816                    self.step_ev,
817                    self.time_per_step,
818                    self.pass_no,
819                    row_index + 1,
820                    self.batch_pass_no,
821                    True,
822                )
823        return
824
825    def saveMeasurementData(self, batch: bool) -> None:
826        """Save the measurement data to a CSV file.
827
828        Parameters
829        ----------
830        batch : bool
831            The type of measurement. True for batch measurement, False for single measurement.
832        """
833        if not batch:
834            wait = wx.BusyCursor()
835            wxsavefiledialog1 = wx.FileDialog(
836                self,
837                "Save data as",
838                defaultFile=wx.DateTime.UNow().Format("%d%m%y"),
839                wildcard="CSV files(*.csv)|*.csv",
840                style=wx.FD_SAVE | wx.FD_OVERWRITE_PROMPT,
841            )
842            if wxsavefiledialog1.ShowModal() == wx.ID_CANCEL:
843                wxsavefiledialog1.SetFilename("")
844                # copy of file for plotting
845                filename = self.DEP_PATH + "aktualdata.csv"
846
847                self.data_table.write_csv(filename)
848            else:
849                if len(wxsavefiledialog1.GetFilename()):
850                    filename = wxsavefiledialog1.GetPath()
851
852                    self.data_table.write_csv(filename)
853                    self.plot_fig.write_html(
854                        filename.removesuffix(".csv") + ".html",
855                        config=self.CONFIG,
856                        include_plotlyjs="cdn",
857                    )
858
859                    # copy of file for plotting
860                    filename = self.DEP_PATH + "aktualdata.csv"
861
862                    self.data_table.write_csv(filename)
863
864                wxsavefiledialog1.SetFilename("")
865            del wait
866            self.measProgress.SetValue(self.measProgress.GetRange())
867            self.remainingTime.SetValue(str(0.0))
868            self.enableControls()
869            time.sleep(1)
870            self.sendSharedData(None, False, False, False, 1, 1)
871            self.plot_iter = 1
872            self.Update()
873        return
874
875    def sendSharedData(
876        self, data: dict | None, meas_running: bool, cancelled: bool, batch_mode: bool, batch_no: int, point_iter: int
877    ) -> None:
878        """Method to save data to the Shared Memory which is also accessed by the plot server for plotting.
879
880        Parameters
881        ----------
882        data : dict | None
883            The data dictionary for the plot.
884        meas_running : bool
885            Boolean indicating whether the measurement is currently running.
886        cancelled : bool
887            Boolean indicating whether the measurement was cancelled.
888        batch_mode : bool
889            Boolean indicating if the measurement is a batch measurement.
890        batch_no : int
891            Integer indicating the index of the batch measurement.
892        point_iter : int
893            Integer indicating the iteration point to control which point the plot server is updating.
894        """
895        if data is not None:
896            self.share_mem_plot_data["fig"] = data
897        self.share_mem_plot_data["run_status"] = meas_running
898        self.share_mem_plot_data["iteration"] = point_iter
899        self.share_mem_plot_data["cancelled"] = cancelled
900        self.share_mem_plot_data["batch_details"] = dict(
901            batch_type=batch_mode,
902            batch_no=batch_no,
903            batch_pass_no=self.batch_pass_no,
904        )
905
906    def startPlotServer(self, event: wx.Event | None) -> None:
907        r"""Code to execute when the Restart Plot Server button is clicked.
908
909        Parameters
910        ----------
911        event : wxEvent | None
912            wxEVT_BUTTON event generated. None when the method if to be fired by other means.
913
914        """
915        self.plotView.Reload()
916        self.plot_server_process = subprocess.Popen(
917            ["start", "/MIN", "cmd", "/k", "python", os.getcwd() + "\\src\\dependencies\\plot_dash_client_copy.py"],
918            shell=True,
919        )
920        # event.Skip()
921
922    def enableControls(self) -> None:
923        """Enable the controls in the UI."""
924        self.modeSelect.Enable()
925        self.startButton.Enable()
926        self.excitationSelect.Enable()
927        self.Update()
928
929    def disableControls(self) -> None:
930        """Disable the controls in the UI."""
931        self.modeSelect.Disable()
932        self.startButton.Disable()
933        self.excitationSelect.Disable()
934        self.Update()
935
936    def interruptionClicked(self, event: wx.Event) -> None:
937        """Handle the interruption of the measurement.
938
939        Parameters
940        ----------
941        event : wxEvent
942            wxEVT_BUTTON event generated.
943
944        """
945        self.meas_interrupted = True
946        self.meas_running = False
947        if event.GetId() == wx.ID_CANCEL:
948            self.meas_interrupt_id = wx.ID_CANCEL
949        else:
950            self.meas_interrupt_id = wx.ID_STOP
951        self.enableControls()
952        event.Skip()
953
954    def onClose(self, event) -> None:
955        """Method fired when the close button is clicked.
956
957        Parameters
958        ----------
959        event : wx.Event
960            The close event that calls the function.
961
962        """
963        event.Skip()
964        self.plot_server_process.terminate()
965
966        self.share_mem_plot_data.shm.close()
967        self.share_mem_plot_data.shm.unlink()
968        self.plotView.Destroy()
969        self.Destroy()
970        app.ExitMainLoop()
971        os._exit(0)
972
973
974if __name__ == "__main__":
975    frame = MainWindow(None)
976    pywinstyles.apply_style(frame, "mica")
977    frame.Show(True)
978    frame.Centre()
979    frame.SetFocus()
980    app.MainLoop()
